title: Shuai Ma
text:
I am an aspiring PhD researcher with interests in urban development, housing policy, and the application of AI and machine learning to climate-resilient real estate and urban systems.
My research focuses on how data-driven and interpretable machine-learning models can support more equitable and climate-resilient urban planning and investment decisions.

title: Shuai Ma
text:
I am an aspiring PhD researcher with interests in urban development, housing policy, and the application of AI and machine learning to climate-resilient real estate and urban systems.
My research focuses on how data-driven and interpretable machine-learning models can support more equitable and climate-resilient urban planning and investment decisions.

title: Shuai Ma
text:
Research Interests

Climate-Resilient Urban Development

Housing Affordability and Real Estate Markets

Interpretable Machine Learning for Policy Analysis

Urban Data Science and Spatial Analytics

title: Shuai Ma
text:
Current Focus
I am currently developing research ideas around AI-enabled housing affordability modeling and climate risk assessment, with an emphasis on policy-relevant and equity-aware frameworks.

title: Research
text:
My research interests lie at the intersection of urban planning, housing and real estate economics, climate resilience, and artificial intelligence.
I am particularly interested in developing interpretable and policy-relevant machine-learning models that can inform public investment and planning decisions.

title: Research
text:
My research interests lie at the intersection of urban planning, housing and real estate economics, climate resilience, and artificial intelligence.
I am particularly interested in developing interpretable and policy-relevant machine-learning models that can inform public investment and planning decisions.

title: Research
text:
Urban Development & Planning
I study how urban form, land-use regulation, and infrastructure investment influence long-term urban resilience and social equity.
Key themes include: - Urban spatial structure and risk exposure
- Planning institutions and policy constraints
- Climate adaptation in metropolitan regions

title: Research
text:
Housing & Real Estate
My work explores housing affordability and real estate dynamics under climate and economic uncertainty.
Key topics: - Housing supply constraints and zoning
- Climate risk pricing in real estate markets
- Housing policy evaluation

title: Research
text:
AI & Machine Learning Methods
Methodologically, I focus on: - Interpretable machine-learning models
- Equity-aware and fairness-constrained modeling
- Spatial and temporal prediction
with an emphasis on translating model insights into actionable policy rules.

title: Projects
text:
Below are selected ongoing or completed projects related to my research interests.



Description:
Developing machine-learning models to analyze housing affordability dynamics across U.S. metropolitan areas.
Data:
- U.S. Census / ACS
- Housing price indices
- Climate risk indicators
Methods:
- Tree-based models
- Feature importance and interpretability analysis
Status:
In progress




Description:
Exploring how climate vulnerability metrics can be incorporated into urban capital investment decision-making.
Focus:
- Flood and heat risk
- Public infrastructure planning
Status:
Conceptual framework development
